Article.Abstract: OBJECTIVE: To determine whether synthetic peptides containing an amino terminal formyl-methionine residue and corresponding to the sequence of several proteins produced by Mycobacterium tuberculosis, would elicit an immune response in mice. DESIGN: Peptides corresponding to the amino termini of 8 M. tuberculosis proteins and initiating with formyl methionine residues were synthesized. The ability of these peptides to bind to the mouse non-classical MHC class I molecule H-2M3a was determined by flow microfluorimetry. These peptides were used to pulse dendritic cells that were then injected into normal mice. These mice were subsequently challenged with aerosolized M. tuberculosis and, 30 days later, the number of viable bacteria in the lungs was determined. RESULTS: Four of the 8 synthetic peptides bound to H-2M3a and stabilized its expression on the cell surface. Injection of mice with dendritic cells pulsed with H-2M3a binding peptides elicited non-MHC restricted cytotoxic T lymphocytes that killed peptide pulsed target cells and macrophages infected with M. tuberculosis. Immunization of mice with syngeneic dendritic cells pulsed in vitro with 2 of these peptides led to retardation of the growth of M. tuberculosis following aerosol challenge. CONCLUSION: Peptides that bind to non-polymorphic class I molecules can elicit immune reactivity directed towards M. tuberculosis.
Article.ArticleTitle: Immunization with f-Met peptides induces immune reactivity against Mycobacterium tuberculosis.
Article.Affiliations: Department of Medicine, National Jewish Centre for Immunology and Respiratory Medicine, Denver, CO, USA.
Article.ArticleChemicalList: Bacterial Vaccines;Histocompatibility Antigens Class I;Vaccines, Synthetic;N-Formylmethionine
Article.ArticleMeshHeadingsList: Animals; Bacterial Vaccines(immunology); Binding, Competitive(immunology); Colony Count, Microbial; Dendritic Cells(immunology); Flow Cytometry; Histocompatibility Antigens Class I(immunology); Immunity, Cellular; Immunization; Mice; Mice, Inbred C57BL; Mycobacterium tuberculosis(immunology; isolation & purification); N-Formylmethionine(immunology); T-Lymphocytes, Cytotoxic(immunology); Vaccines, Synthetic(immunology)

Journal.Title: Tubercle and lung disease : the official journal of the International Union against Tuberculosis and Lung Disease.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Administration in vivo to prevent or reduce disease
FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 injection of 10 μM peptide-pulsed dendritic cells.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Dendritic cell injection was given 10 days before challenge with aerosolized MTb. 30 days later, the mice were sacrificed and the number of bacteria in one lobe of the lungs was determined.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Mice immunized with peptide-loaded syngeneic dendritic cells did not experience significant protection to MTb proliferation.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 2 injections 4 wk apart of 10 μM peptide-pulsed dendritic cells, first intrasplenic and second intraperitoneal.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: 2 weeks after second injection, spleen cells were restimulated with syngeneic splenocytes pulsed with 10 μM peptide for 6 days.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: This negative data was not shown, but was mentioned in the text. The lack of recognition of target cells indicates this peptide is not immunogenic for CD8+ T cells due to its lack of binding for M3 molecules.

M3 stabilization was measured using a fibroblast cell line from B10.CAS2 mice (H-2M3b; incapable of binding formylated peptides) and transfected with a gene encoding a chimeric H-2M3a/Ld molecule in which the wild type a3, transmembrane and cytoplasmic, domains of the H-2M3a gene were replaced with the corresponding regions from H-2Ld. Staining was performed with an anti-Ld antibody. The results were confirmed by the lack of competition for binding to M3 in a CTL assay.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Formylated peptide corresponding to N-terminal 11 aa from 35KDa protein is shown to bind to M3 molecules, elicit CTL responses against peptide-pulsed and source species-infected target cells, and provide protection to infection spread after aerosol challenge.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 2 injections 4 wk apart of 10 μM peptide-pulsed dendritic cells, first intrasplenic and second intraperitoneal.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: 2 weeks after second injection, spleen cells were restimulated with syngeneic splenocytes pulsed with 10 μM peptide for 6 days.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The CTL response appeared to be 'MHC unrestricted' with both syngeneic (H-2b) and allogeneic (H-2d) cells presenting peptide being lysed.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Administration in vivo to prevent or reduce disease
FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 injection of 10 μM peptide-pulsed dendritic cells.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Dendritic cell injection was given 10 days before challenge with aerosolized MTb. 30 days later, the mice were sacrificed and the number of bacteria in one lobe of the lungs was determined.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Mice immunized with peptide-loaded syngeneic dendritic cells experience significant protection to MTb proliferation.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 2 injections 4 wk apart of 10 μM peptide-pulsed dendritic cells, first intrasplenic and second intraperitoneal.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: 2 weeks after second injection, spleen cells were restimulated with syngeneic splenocytes pulsed with 10 μM peptide for 6 days.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Recognition of MTb infected target cells indicates this peptide is naturally processed in vitro. The same results were obtained when CTLs were similarly raised in BALB/c mice. This was confirmed in vivo by recognition of MTb infected target cells by CTLs from MTb primed mice.

M3 stabilization was measured using a fibroblast cell line from B10.CAS2 mice (H-2M3b; incapable of binding formylated peptides) and transfected with a gene encoding a chimeric H-2M3a/Ld molecule in which the wild type a3, transmembrane and cytoplasmic, domains of the H-2M3a gene were replaced with the corresponding regions from H-2Ld. Staining was performed with an anti-Ld antibody. The non-formylated peptide corresponding to the N-terminal 11 aa from the 35KDa protein is negative for binding to M3 molecules. The results were confirmed by the lack of competition for binding to M3 in a CTL assay.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Non-formylated peptide corresponding to N-terminal 11 aa from 35KDa protein is negative for binding to M3 molecules, while formylated peptide is positive.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: M3 stabilization was measured using a fibroblast cell line from B10.CAS2 mice (H-2M3b; incapable of binding formylated peptides) and transfected with a gene encoding a chimeric H-2M3a/Ld molecule in which the wild type a3, transmembrane and cytoplasmic, domains of the H-2M3a gene were replaced with the corresponding regions from H-2Ld. Staining was performed with an anti-Ld antibody. The non-formylated peptide corresponding to the N-terminal 11 aa from the 35KDa protein is negative for binding to M3 molecules.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Formylated peptide corresponding to N-terminal 11 aa from 85A antigen is shown to bind to M3 molecules, elicit CTL responses against peptide-pulsed and source species infected target cells, but not to provide protection to infection spread after aerosol challenge. Also known as Antigen 85-A precursor, 85A, Antigen 85 complex A, Ag85A, Mycolyl transferase 85A and Fibronectin-binding protein A.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 2 injections 4 wk apart of 10 μM peptide-pulsed dendritic cells, first intrasplenic and second intraperitoneal.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: 2 weeks after second injection, spleen cells were restimulated with syngeneic splenocytes pulsed with 10 μM peptide for 6 days.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Recognition of MTb infected target cells indicates this peptide is naturally processed in vitro. The same results were obtained when CTLs were similarly raised in BALB/c mice. This was confirmed in vivo by recognition of MTb infected target cells by CTLs from MTb primed mice.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 2 injections 4 wk apart of 10 μM peptide-pulsed dendritic cells, first intrasplenic and second intraperitoneal.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: 2 weeks after second injection, spleen cells were restimulated with syngeneic splenocytes pulsed with 10 μM peptide for 6 days.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The authors stated that CTLs from peptide immunized with in vitro restimulation with peptide lysed peptide pulsed target cells.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Administration in vivo to prevent or reduce disease
FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 injection of 10 μM peptide-pulsed dendritic cells.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Dendritic cell injection was given 10 days before challenge with aerosolized MTb. 30 days later, the mice were sacrificed and the number of bacteria in one lobe of the lungs was determined.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Mice immunized with peptide-loaded syngeneic dendritic cells did not experience significant protection to MTb proliferation.

M3 stabilization was measured using a fibroblast cell line from B10.CAS2 mice (H-2M3b; incapable of binding formylated peptides) and transfected with a gene encoding a chimeric H-2M3a/Ld molecule in which the wild type a3, transmembrane and cytoplasmic, domains of the H-2M3a gene were replaced with the corresponding regions from H-2Ld. Staining was performed with an anti-Ld antibody. The non-formylated peptide corresponding to the N-terminal 11 aa from the 35KDa protein is negative for binding to M3 molecules. The results were confirmed by the lack of competition for binding to M3 in a CTL assay.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Non-formylated peptide corresponding to N-terminal 11 aa from 85A antigen is negative for binding to M3 molecules, while formylated version is positive. Also known as Antigen 85-A precursor, 85A, Antigen 85 complex A, Ag85A, Mycolyl transferase 85A and Fibronectin-binding protein A.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: M3 stabilization was measured using a fibroblast cell line from B10.CAS2 mice (H-2M3b; incapable of binding formylated peptides) and transfected with a gene encoding a chimeric H-2M3a/Ld molecule in which the wild type a3, transmembrane and cytoplasmic, domains of the H-2M3a gene were replaced with the corresponding regions from H-2Ld. Staining was performed with an anti-Ld antibody. The non-formylated peptide corresponding to the N-terminal 11 aa from the 35KDa protein is negative for binding to M3 molecules, while the formylated peptide is positive.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Formylated peptide corresponding to N-terminal 11 aa from 14 kDa antigen is shown to bind to M3 molecules, but to elicit weak CTL responses against peptide-pulsed target cells, and fails to provide protection to infection spread after aerosol challenge. Also known as 16 kDa antigen and HSP 16.3.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 2 injections 4 wk apart of 10 μM peptide-pulsed dendritic cells, first intrasplenic and second intraperitoneal.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: 2 weeks after second injection, spleen cells were restimulated with syngeneic splenocytes pulsed with 10 μM peptide for 6 days.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The authors state that CTLs obtained from peptide immunized mice followed by an in vitro restimulation with peptide weakly lyse peptide-pulsed target cells.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 injection of 10 μM peptide-pulsed dendritic cells.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Dendritic cell injection was given 10 days before challenge with aerosolized MTb. 30 days later, the mice were sacrificed and the number of bacteria in one lobe of the lungs was determined.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Non-formylated peptide corresponding to N-terminal 11 aa from 85C antigen is negative for binding to M3 molecules, while formylated peptide is positive. Staining was performed with an anti-Ld antibody. The non-formylated peptide corresponding to the N-terminal 11 aa from the 35KDa protein is negative for binding to M3 molecules, while the formylated peptide is positive.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Formylated peptide corresponding to N-terminal 11 aa from 19KDa antigen is unable to bind to M3 molecules and to elicit CTL responses against peptide pulsed target cells. Also known as lipoprotein lpqH precursor and 19 kDa lipoprotein antigen.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 2 injections 4 wk apart of 10 μM peptide-pulsed dendritic cells, first intrasplenic and second intraperitoneal.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The lack of recognition of target cells indicates this peptide is not immunogenic for CD8+ T cells due to its lack of binding for M3 molecules.

Staining was performed with an anti-Ld antibody.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Formylated peptide corresponding to N-terminal 8 aa from 85B antigen is unable to bind to M3 molecules and to elicit CTL responses against peptide-pulsed target cells. Also known as Antigen 85-B precursor, 85B, Extracellular alpha-antigen, Antigen 85 complex B, Ag85B and Mycolyl transferase 85B.
